data.title: Forced empathy and activism: Tania Bruguera at Turbine Hall
data.meta_description: Forced empathy and activism: Tania Bruguera at the Turbine Hall. The 10.144.083 exhibition at the Tate Modern (October 2, 2018 - February 24, 2019) emphasizes the phenomenon of migration and recalls the museum to its civic role.
data.text:
10,144,083. Tania Bruguera at the Turbine Hall: temporary imprints and forced empathy. The provocation on the drama of migration

The artist, choosing as the theme the epochal tragedy of refugees and fugitives who, despite being a phenomenon of contemporaneity, does not raise any collective response to rescue, wants to induce the museum to collaborate with the inhabitants of the area, removing the self-referentiality of the cultural system and calling it to the civic role.
